title: Identify type of lens from formed images

content.question: A student holds a lens <math alttext="40 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>40 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from an object and observes an enlarged image on a screen on the opposite side of the lens. Which of the following could be the type of lens and its focal length?

choices.label: Type of Lens Focal Length Diverging <math alttext="30 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>30 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
Type of Lens Focal Length Diverging <math alttext="50 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>50 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
Type of Lens Focal Length Converging <math alttext="30 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>30 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
Type of Lens Focal Length Converging <math alttext="50 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>50 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Type of Lens Focal Length Converging <math alttext="30 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>30 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
